2.text: “How long will you hunt for words? Consider, and afterwards we will speak.

3.text: Why are we counted as animals, which have become unclean in your sight?

4.text: You who tear yourself in your anger, shall the earth be forsaken for you? Or shall the rock be removed out of its place?

5.text: “Yes, the light of the wicked shall be put out, The spark of his fire shall not shine.

6.text: The light shall be dark in his tent. His lamp above him shall be put out.

7.text: The steps of his strength shall be shortened. His own counsel shall cast him down.

8.text: For he is cast into a net by his own feet, and he wanders into its mesh.

9.text: A snare will take him by the heel. A trap will catch him.

10.text: A noose is hidden for him in the ground, a trap for him in the way.

11.text: Terrors shall make him afraid on every side, and shall chase him at his heels.

12.text: His strength shall be famished. Calamity shall be ready at his side.

13.text: The members of his body shall be devoured. The firstborn of death shall devour his members.

14.text: He shall be rooted out of his tent where he trusts. He shall be brought to the king of terrors.

15.text: There shall dwell in his tent that which is none of his. Sulfur shall be scattered on his habitation.

16.text: His roots shall be dried up beneath. Above shall his branch be cut off.

17.text: His memory shall perish from the earth. He shall have no name in the street.

18.text: He shall be driven from light into darkness, and chased out of the world.

19.text: He shall have neither son nor grandson among his people, nor any remaining where he lived.

20.text: Those who come after shall be astonished at his day, as those who went before were frightened.

21.text: Surely such are the dwellings of the unrighteous. This is the place of him who doesn’t know God.”
